text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a curried beef short rib with
cauliflower in coconut milk so this is
what I call American curry because it's
really not an authentic curry from like
India or Thailand or something like that
it's it's kind of inspired by those
things but it's really more than
anything a simple beef stew
and speaking of beef here's what we're
using beef short ribs I have about three
and a half pounds here let's at one two
three four five six seven eight nine
pieces so the first step is I'm going to
throw them on a baking sheet with some
foil very lightly oiled I'm going to
season those with salt pepper and a
little bit of cayenne and also secret
ingredient about a teaspoon of garam
masala which is like an Indian spice
mixture you know similar to like a curry
powder and you can find that in your
better spice departments so once those
are seasoned generously on all sides I'm
going to spread those out I'm going to
place them in a hot oven 400 degrees for
about 15-20 minutes until they're
browned all right in the meantime while
those are browning I'm going to start
the base of our curry alright so in a
heavy Dutch oven I have one onion
roughly chopped about a teaspoon of
vegetable oil some tomato paste and some
red curry paste I'm going to put that on
medium heat and I'm simply going to
soften the onions Wow
slightly toasting the tomato paste and
curry paste okay so I'm gonna let that
go for about three minutes and then I'm
going to add some whole cloves of garlic
and in this case we're not crushing them
or chopping them or mincing them I just
want them in their hole so I'm gonna
stir those in and I'm going to keep this
on medium heat until it looks sort of
like this I don't want the curry paste
browning or getting really dark on the
bottom of the pot but I do want it to
toast a little bit and I do want a
little bit of caramelization that's fine
okay when it looks like that I'm going
to dump in my coconut milk stir that in
and by the way if you've never braised
meat in coconut milk before you are in
for a huge huge treat and then the rest
of the liquid I'm going to add some
chicken stock or chicken broth and
that's pretty much going to be our
cooking liquid now as far as flavorings
and seasonings go I'm going to need
little bit of salt in this I'm going to
use fish sauce because you know what I
love it and for these type of
asian-inspired dishes it doesn't get any
better than using fish sauce for your
salt element you could use a little bit
of soy you could use regular salt but
try to get some fish sauce please
I'm also going to throw in two large bay
leaves and one star nice
alright star nice and braised beef a
perfect perfect combination so to get
this in the oven I'm going to bring that
up to a simmer you can turn the heat up
to medium-high if you want by that time
our short ribs should be nicely browned
I'm going to transfer those from the pan
to the pot and once those are in the
liquid the braising liquid should come
up just to the top and you'll see I put
sort of the bone side up so the meats in
the actual aromatic broth there so that
looks perfect I'm going to cover that
I'm going to turn the oven down all the
way to 300 and that's going to braise
for three hours until fork-tender and
when they're fork-tender I'm going to
take those beef short ribs out of the
pot and you can see they're totally fork
tender all right let's set those aside
and finish our curry so I'm going to
place the braising liquid on high heat
it's going to start to boil and you're
going to skim whatever fat you can get
off the top I mean you can leave a
little bit but you should probably take
most of it off once you've skimmed that
and you found any extra random bones
that fell out of the meat I'm going to
go ahead and place in my cauliflower
which was simply a head of cauliflower
that I cut into bite-size pieces so
basically we're going to put the lid
back on and boil that cauliflower for
about five minutes or until tender I
like mine soft you might like yours
firmer alright you're the boss of your
curry so you cook it how you want but I
went all the way till mine was tender I
added the beef back in you'll notice
there's no bones those bones pull right
out of that braised beef okay so I
didn't show that I probably should have
but it's simply just pulling that one
bone right out there's really nothing to
it alright so once the beefs in there
I'm going to finish this with some
freshly chopped green onions and a big
handful of freshly chopped or
I did sweet basil now if you can find
Thai basil I'd use that it's very cool
stuff but if you can't regular basil
will work stir that in check your
seasoning you might need a little more
salt
you might need a little more heat I put
in a little extra cayenne here all right
up to you but always taste your food
before you serve it and that my friends
is done and if I may say incredibly
delicious all right I spoon that up into
a bowl that just amazingly tender
succulent beef short rib there's really
few meats they braise nicer than beef
short rib in fact I can't really think
of any and that soft beautifully tender
cauliflower all right our spicy but not
too crazy spicy curry sauce the
sweetness of the coconut milk a little
bit of aromatic from the star anis and
the bay you can call it a curry you can
call it whatever you want
all I know is this is a great great bowl
of food so if you're a fan of curries
you like this if you're a fan of beef
stews you'll like this if you're a fan
of both beef stews and curries then you
really got something here so I hope you
give that a try all the ingredient
amounts are on food wishes calm as usual
and as always enjoy
